unnormalised: Bengaluru-based startup, CodeZenith, just announced the release of their new AI-powered code debugging tool, "DebugPro AI v2.0". The launch event, held earlier today at the Bangalore Tech Summit, saw a huge turnout. CEO, Rohan Sharma, highlighted the tool's ability to reduce debugging time by up to 40%, claiming it can handle complex errors across multiple languages like Python, Java, and C++.
normalised: Bengaluru-based startup, CodeZenith, just announced the release of their new A-I-powered code debugging tool, "DebugPro A-I version two point zero". The launch event, held earlier today at the Bangalore Tech Summit, saw a huge turnout. C-E-O, Rohan Sharma, highlighted the tool's ability to reduce debugging time by up to forty percent, claiming it can handle complex errors across multiple languages like Python, Java, and C plus plus.

unnormalised: The initial beta testing phase, which involved 50 developers from companies like TCS and Infosys, yielded extremely positive results. DebugPro AI v2.0 reportedly identified and resolved over 85% of bugs automatically during the test period. The tool boasts a streamlined UI and compatibility with popular IDEs like VS Code and IntelliJ. It's priced at ₹999/month for individual developers and ₹4999/month for teams.
normalised: The initial beta testing phase, which involved fifty developers from companies like T-C-S and Infosys, yielded extremely positive results. DebugPro A-I version two point zero reportedly identified and resolved over eighty five percent of bugs automatically during the test period. The tool boasts a streamlined U-I and compatibility with popular I-D-Es like V-S Code and IntelliJ. It's priced at rupee nine hundred and ninety nine per month for individual developers and rupee four thousand nine hundred and ninety nine per month for teams.

unnormalised: CodeZenith plans to roll out DebugPro AI v2.0 globally by Q4 2024. A free trial version is available for download on their website, codezenith.in. Analysts predict this tool could significantly impact the software development landscape, especially in India where there's a huge demand for efficient coding solutions.
normalised: CodeZenith plans to roll out DebugPro A-I version two point zero globally by Q four two thousand and twenty four. A free trial version is available for download on their website, codezenith dot in. Analysts predict this tool could significantly impact the software development landscape, especially in India where there's a huge demand for efficient coding solutions.
